contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Airport | name = Yellowstone Regional Airport | image = | IATA = COD | ICAO = KCOD | FAA = COD | type = Public | owner = City of Cody | operator = | city-served = [[Cody, Wyoming]] | location = <!--if different than above--> | elevation-f = 5,102 | elevation-m = 1,555 | coordinates = {{coord|44|31|13|N|109|01|26|W|region:US-WY_type:airport}} | website = [http://www.flyyra.com/ www.FlyYRA.com] | r1-number = 4/22 | r1-length-f = 8,268 | r1-length-m = 2,520 | r1-surface = Asphalt | stat-year = 2008 | stat1-header = Aircraft operations | stat1-data = 37,490 | stat2-header = Based aircraft | stat2-data = 68 | footnotes = Source: [[Federal Aviation Administration]]<ref name="FAA">{{FAA-airport|ID=COD|use=PU|own=PU|site=27765.*A}}. Federal Aviation Administration. Effective 29 July 2010.</ref> }} '''Yellowstone Regional Airport''' {{airport codes|COD|KCOD|COD}} is a public-use [[airport]] located two nautical miles (3.7 km) southeast of the [[central business district]] of [[Cody, Wyoming|Cody]], a city in [[Park County, Wyoming|Park County]], [[Wyoming]], [[United States]].<ref name="FAA" /> It is the only commercial airport in [[Park County, Wyoming|Park County]]. It is in northwestern [[Wyoming]], about 53 miles from the east entrance of [[Yellowstone National Park]]. The airport is owned by the city of Cody and is operated by the Yellowstone Regional Airport Joint Powers Board. This board was established in 1981 and is made up of 7 members appointed the Cody City Council and the Park County Commission.<ref>[http://www.flyyra.com/aboutyra.php Yellowstone Regional Airport New Terminal Building]</ref> The daily operations of the airport are overseen by an Airport Manager, who is appointed by the board. It should not be confused with [[Yellowstone Airport]], located 104 miles (167 km) away in [[West Yellowstone, Montana]], near the west entrance to Yellowstone National Park. == Facilities and aircraft == Yellowstone Regional Airport covers an area of {{convert|694|acre|ha|lk=on}} at an [[elevation]] of 5,102 feet (1,555 m) above [[mean sea level]]. It has one [[runway]] designated 4/22 with an [[asphalt]] surface measuring 8,268 by 100 feet (2,520 x 30 m).<ref name="FAA" /> For the 12-month period ending December 31, 2008, the airport had 37,490 aircraft operations, an average of 102 per day: 83% [[general aviation]], 17% [[air taxi]], and <1% [[military aviation|military]]. At that time there were 68 aircraft based at this airport: 82% single-[[aircraft engine|engine]], 6% multi-engine, 7% [[jet aircraft|jet]], 3% [[helicopter]], and 2% [[glider (sailplane)|glider]].<ref name="FAA" /> A new $12.5 million airport terminal recently opened in December 2010.<ref>[http://www.flyyra.com/images/YRA-Economic_Impact.pdf YRA New Terminal]</ref><ref>[http://www.passengerterminaltoday.com/news.php?NewsID=3465 Passenger Terminal Today<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.flyyra.com/new_terminal.php Yellowstone Regional Airport Joint Powers Board]</ref> 95% of the cost for the new terminal is paid with an FAA grant, 3% is coming from the Wyoming State Aeronautics Division and the remaining 2% comes from the airport itself.<ref>[http://www.flyyra.com/images/YRA-Economic_Impact.pdf YRA New Terminal Funding Sources]</ref> Choice Aviation and Spirit Mountain Aviation, the airport's [[fixed base operator]]s (FBOs), offer fuel, flight instruction, aircraft/hangar rental, and other services. == Airlines and destinations == {{Airport-dest-list | [[Delta Connection]] operated by [[SkyWest Airlines]] | [[Salt Lake City International Airport|Salt Lake City]]<ref>http://news.yahoo.com/skywest-continue-flights-cody-salt-lake-115535602.html</ref> | [[United Express]] operated by [[SkyWest Airlines]] | [[Denver International Airport|Denver]] }} ==Air cargo== [[United Parcel Service|UPS]] and [[FedEx]] both offer [[air cargo]] services at the airport. ==Ground transportation== [[Budget Rent a Car|Budget]], [[The Hertz Corporation|Hertz]], and [[Thrifty Rent a Car|Thrifty]] all offer rental cars at the airport. ==Passenger services== Yellowstone Regional Airport offers free Wi-Fi Internet service in its terminal. In addition, food and beverage service is available at a restaurant at the airport. ==References== <references /> == External links == * [http://www.flyyra.com/ Yellowstone Regional Airport] * [http://msrmaps.com/map.aspx?t=1&s=12&lat=44.5202&lon=-109.0238&w=700&h=550&lp=---+None+--- Aerial image as of 24 August 1994] from [[USGS]] ''[[The National Map]]'' * {{FAA-procedures|COD}} * {{US-airport-ga|COD}} [[Category:Airports in Wyoming]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Park County, Wyoming]] [[Category:Transportation in Park County, Wyoming]]
